description:
Having moved back to Japan from abroad, Rinku Aimoto transfers to Yoba Academy where DJing is popular. She is deeply moved by a DJ concert she sees there, and decides to form a unit of her own with Maho Akashi, Muni Ohnaruto, and Rei Togetsu.

While interacting with the other DJ units like Peaky P-key and Photon Maiden, Rinku and her friends aim for the high stage!

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The first episode was released early on the official D4DJ and Funimation YouTube channels on October 23, 2020. The regular TV broadcast started on October 30, 2020.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oichanmusi) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/oichanmusi.bsky.social) | [Website](https://hifumi-inc.co.jp/team/mizushima-seiji/)

After graduating from Tokyo Designers' Gakuin College, Mizushima joined [Tokyo Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/899/). While doing photography work at the beginning of his career he studied under director of photography [Masahiro Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/174419/). He later went to work for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant, aiming to become a full-fledged director.

Mizushima debuted as an episode director in 1993 on [Kouryuu Densetsu Villgust](https://anilist.co/anime/2049/), aiding the director of the OVA [Katsuhiko Nishijima](https://anilist.co/staff/103059/). In 1998, he made his proper directorial debut with [Generator Gawl](https://anilist.co/anime/1022/). He has since gone on to direct numerous shows, among which [Shaman King](https://anilist.co/anime/154/), [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/) and [Oh! Edo Rocket](https://anilist.co/anime/2152/).

He often cites [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/) as an anime director that he respects.

[Official Website](https://bushiroad.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kidanit)

Takaaki Kidani is a Japanese businessman. He is the founder and president of Bushiroad. Kidani has also served as the chairman of New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). He continues to be involved with NJPW through Bushiroad, in which owns the company.

He founded Bushiroad in May 2007 as a company that produces card games and assumed the position of president. The origin of the name Bushiroad comes from the failure to make Neppu Kairiku Bushi Road into a film due to various reasons when he led the project in the days of Broccoli. The film was restarted in March 2013 with Kidani as the executive producer. The company would create numerous media franchises including Tantei Opera Milky Holmes and BanG Dream!

[Website](http://www.nakamurakou.com/) | [Blog](http://kou.livedoor.biz/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nkkou)

Kou Nakamura is a novelist and winner of the 39th Bungei Prize in 2002. He also won the Noma Literary Newcomer Prize in 2004.

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marioversion2)

**Height:** 153cm

[Profile](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/nishio_yuka/) | [Website](http://haruca.info/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/240y_k) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/240y_k/)

Haruka Nishio, better known by her stage name Yuuka Nishio is a Japanese singer, voice actress and DJ from Kanagawa Prefecture who is affiliated with Hibiki. She was formerly active as a solo musician under the name Haruca, releasing the single "Eien no Kotae" in 2017. She is known for her roles as Nanami Hiromachi in BanG Dream!, where she also serves as the bassist of the band Morfonica, and as Rinku Aimoto, the protagonist of the multimedia franchise D4DJ.

**Height:** 147cm

[Profile](http://acecrew.co.jp/talent/mimuraharuka.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mimuharu_1027) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mimuraharuka_1027/)

**Height:** 156cm

[Profile](https://www.s-inc.jp/artist/各務-華梨/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kagami_karin) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kagami_karin/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kanon_Shizaki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kshizaki_official/)

Kanon is a voice actress from Tokyo. She made her debut in 2018 as the new voice for Rinko Shirokane and keyboardist in the band [Roselia](https://anilist.co/staff/153170/Roselia), replacing Satomi Akesaka, as part the BanG Dream! project. Kanon played the piano for 12 years prior to joining the project. 

She also has a talent for singing, with her vocal key ranging from E3 to G5, and her falsetto (whistle voice) key to be at E6. Her hobbies include watching movies and listening to music, and her skills include singing, playing the keyboard, classical ballet, and calligraphy. She also has a younger sister with whom she doesn't get along well with. 

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)

Affiliated with Studio Anima.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [background artist](https://anilist.co/staff/156392/)._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zappago)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kameari_Kanata)

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100003558003913)__

__Residency:__ Fujisawa, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kugenuma High School, Yoyogi Animation Academy

__Aiko Matsuyama__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter, who mainly does finishing.
Kenta Tsuboi is a background artist.

__[Website](https://ciqii.com/)__ | __[Profile (Hifumi Inc.)](https://hifumi-inc.co.jp/y0c1e/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/y0c1e)__ | __[Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/y0c1e)__

__Ryouhei Sataka__, alternatively known by stage name y0c1e, is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, sound producer and DJ.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MatsuuraHiroaki)

Founder and representative director of [Sanzigen](https://anilist.co/studio/537/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatile) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/1745058)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/risa_tsumugi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tsumurisa/) | [Agency Profile](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/tsumugi_risa/)

A voice actress from Okinawa, Japan. She is the DJ of the band [RAISE A SUILEN](https://anilist.co/staff/153132/). She is affiliated with HiBiKi. 

Risa went to an international school when she was younger, and as a result she is quite skilled in English. She is also proficient in speaking in the Okinawan dialect, as she was born in Okinawa. Risa began dreaming of becoming a voice actress after hearing Aya Hirano's voice acting. In 2017 Risa was scouted and became affiliated with HiBiKi through their rookie scouting. She then debuted with the role of Yuzuki "Hime" Yukimura in the 15th episode of Aikatsu Friends!. Risa's addition RAISE A SUILEN was announced during their second official live on July 17, 2018. On October 19, 2022, she announced her marriage with the composer [Yuuki Honda](https://anilist.co/staff/220707/Yuuki-Honda).

Risa's hobbies include traveling around different shrines and temples, doing illustrations, and collecting temple seals. She is also quite skilled at tennis. Her favorite foods are cheese, jerky, and prosciutto. She often adds English words in her speech and is very energetic.

edges.role: Insert Song Performance ("Wish You Luck"; ep 13)

node.description:
Peaky P-key is an all-girl DJ group in the Dig Delight Direct Drive DJ franchise. They are a popular unit by Yoba Academy's finest students. Their music genre consists of Techno, Rap, Eurobeat and Electro Pop. 

The group is comprised of 4 members:

- [Aimi](https://anilist.co/staff/109519/Aimi) as [Kyouko Yamate](https://anilist.co/character/182718/Kyouko-Yamate)
- [Reo Kurachi](https://anilist.co/staff/137053/Reo-Kurachi) as [Esora Shimizu](https://anilist.co/character/189833/Esora-Shimizu)
- [Miyu Takagi](https://anilist.co/staff/118476/Miyu-Takagi) as [Shinobu Inuyose](https://anilist.co/character/189830/Shinobu-Inuyose)
- [Moeka Koizumi](https://anilist.co/staff/126657/Moeka-Koizumi) as [Yuka Jennifer Sasago](https://anilist.co/character/189828/Yuka-Jennifer-Sasago)

edges.role: Insert Song Lyrics ("Wish You Luck"; ep 13)
